item.description:
Report E-2023040640

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-28T03:10:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-26
  • City: RICHLAND
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal LJS experienced a UN3293 Scav-OX 35% Hydrazine Solution release from a 340-gallon metal tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-cup of product released to the tote body due to a loose lid. The lid was secured, and the tote was wiped down. The absorbent pads were placed into a 5-gallon poly drum. The tote was secured for shipment on. The waste was taken offsite pending disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023040632
item.description:
Report E-2023040632

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-28T03:10:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-07
  • City: MERIDIAN
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Frontier Tank Lines Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 1230 ET, Frontier Tank Lines Inc. notified ERTS of a tanker release at 2150 Russell Mt Gilead Rd, Meridian, MS. It was reported that approximately 80 gallons of a non-hazardous Biodiesel were released from a tanker due to an unknown cause during delivery. No storm drains or waterways were impacted by the release. A 5ft by 10ft area of soil was impacted and a 20ft by 10ft area of the parking lot had a sheen. The contractor applied microblaze to the sheen and scraped the soil area. E3 estimated 30 gallons of fuel were released. One 55-gallon drum was generated and taken to the contractor's site in Clinton MS until proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023030414
item.description:
Report E-2023030414

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-28T03:10:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-07
  • City: PEARL
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On March 07, 2023, six (6) 5-gallon pails containing UN1760 were damaged during a load shift and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior and asphalt pavement. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Enhanced Emergency Environmental (E3) to remediate the impacted site. The crew removed the damaged pails and restacked al nonimpacted pails. The crew then utilized absorbents and hand tools to collect and containerize all UN1760-impacted material in three (3) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023030412
item.description:
Report E-2023030412

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-28T03:10:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-17
  • City: GULFPORT
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 0940 ET, XPO terminal LGP reported a spill that occurred inside of a trailer in Gulfport, MS. The spill consisted of a 5-gallon plastic jerrycan containing UN2922 Bacticide 45B, which was punctured by a loose nail on the pallet at the bottom of the can, releasing a small amount on the can and the floor of the trailer. ERTS dispatched a contractor for cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to a 1' x 2' area of the trailer floor and a 1' x 1' area of the dock floor due to a pallet nail puncture. Absorbents were utilized to clean the impacted areas. The damaged pail and cleanup debris were containerized into a 55-gallon poly waste drum which was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023010222
item.description:
Report E-2023010222

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-27T21:08:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-01-13
  • City: RICHLAND
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 13, 2023, at 0334 ET, XPO Logistics Terminal LJS experienced a release of UN3265 Depositrol BL5600. Due to a forklift puncture a 55-gallon poly drum of product released impacting the trailer floor and concrete lot below. ERTS dispatched E3 Environmental to the site to perform all cleanup and remediation activities. On January 13, 2023, at 0700 ET, E3 Environmental personnel arrived on site. Contractors confirmed approximately 10-gallons of product released to an 8' X 15' area of the trailer floor and 5-gallons of product released to a 10' X 10' area of the concrete lot below the trailer due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents were worked into the impacted areas. Soda ash and water were then used to neutralize all impacted surfaces. Once cleanup was complete, pH reading inside and outside the trailer showed as 4-5. All impacted absorbents and waste were collected into two 55-gallon poly drums. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly overpack. All waste was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report I-2023020033
item.description:
Report I-2023020033

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-28T00:34:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-11
  • City: GULFPORT
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: BEALINE SERVICE COMPANY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On Nov 11, 2022 approximately around 7:45 PM Republic driver Art Thatcher pulled over at a Flying J's truck stop for his l0hr rest period while in transit to Kimera Chemical in Mobile AL. Around 8pm while Art was conducting his Post trip, he identified a strong smell while walking around the truck. Art noticed a few drops of liquid substance coming from under the trailer close to the king pin. Art immediately grabbed is spill kit and applied it to the area where the liquid was coming from. Art called the on call supervisor around 8:05pm to report to the management team on a possible leak containing Acetic Acid. Art was instructed to call Chemtrec at 8:15pm for further instructions. Chemtrec referred Republic Services to call Environmental Management to assist with the containment and transferring the tanker to another if needed. A replacement tanker was dispatched the following morning while Mr. Thatcher stayed with the contained tanker. Between the time when Mr. Thatcher identified the dripping tanker at 7:45 PM and the completion of the product transfer by Environmental Management less than 1 gallon were contained by the spill kit. Approximately 3:10 PM the next day, the Environmental management Team arrived on site to contain spill. The off load started at 520 PM and was completed at 7:00 PM. Per Environmental Management, there was no product that spilled on the ground

  • Description: XPO terminal LJS reports a release of 2 gallons of "Gramoxone SL 2.0" (UN2922) after a 1,000-gallon tote was punctured by a pallet inside of the trailer. ERTS dispatched E3 to conduct cleanup. At 0616 ET, E3 personnel arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 30 gallons of product released to a 10' 20' area of the concrete lot below the trailer and to the trailer floor. The product was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. Absorbents were then worked into the impacted areas. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized along with all spent absorbents and cleanup debris into four 55 gallon poly drums. All waste was left onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
